name: Vala Steingr√≠msd√≥ttir
bio:
Vala Steingrimsd√≥ttir is an Icelandic illustrator, comic artist and writer that has a special knack for depicting the beauty of nature and people.

Having spent a lot of time in the countryside of Iceland, she has strong ties with nature and environmental activism. It is reflected in her passion for painting ‚Äò‚Äôotherworldly‚Äô‚Äô environments and visuals that border on the poetic with vibrant colours and soft rendering. Moreover, climate action and human rights activism regularly carries into her storytelling and collaborations.

She puts a big emphasis on writing impactful stories with grounded and believable characters and also has a passion for the genre of fantasy, which tends to creep into her work. From beautiful escapist adventures ranging from tales of fantastical realms to mythology and folklore from our world, to children's stories about countryside life and her poignant non-fiction adult comics, she makes engaging stories for all ages.

Vala is based in Denmark at this moment in time, but is a child of the world at heart, and hopes that life will take her many places. As this portfolio reveals Iceland will always have the warmest place in her heart and will be an eternal source of inspiration.

Feel free to get in touch! : )

name: Unnur Snorrad√≥ttir
bio: Unnur Snorrad√≥ttir, an Icelandic artist known for intricate hand sketches and gothic narratives explores modern life, fantasy, and raises awareness of global warming. Snorrad√≥ttir‚Äôs fast-paced drawing style, heavy on black, brings life to her work. She questions the necessity of perfection, valuing self-expression and creative freedom. Influenced by Iceland‚Äôs landscape, her art reflects the urgency of climate change. She spoke with Fluoro.

name: Ymir Arnarson
bio:
I am an Icelandic American cartoonist/graphic novelist with a fierce passion for American cartoons.

I have studied Graphic Storytelling in Denmark and worked with Italian, French, Australian, Portuguese, Finnish, Swedish, German, and Australian story artists for the last five years leading up to my graduation. I think the stories I tell are reflective of these international friends and the intricate connections between our cultures.

Comparing cultures has inspired me to write stories ranging from friends struggling with student debt during their weekly roleplaying game, to exploring the hearts of an isolated father and angry son through a portal world in the woods.

In my own life, living in America, I sometimes felt like a foreigner in my own country. But in moving between these various worlds, I've found a voice that people can relate to as we all become more and more connected with the world and each other.

Email: ymirarnarson@gmail.com

Social: @ymirarnarson

name: Natka Klimowicz
bio:
My name is Natka Klimowicz and I'm a poster designer and an illustrator based in Reykjavik. 

Graduated from University of Arts in Poznan, with MA in graphic design and BA in printmaking.

They say less is more, I say more (color!) is more.

Here to speak visual language for grassroots organizations, minorities and anyone who likes things to look fun. Art + good cause = say no more! Ask me for a poster anytime (‚úß·¥•‚úß)

Turn on. Tune in. Drop me a line.  klimowicz.nat@gmail.com

name: Bj√∂rn Heimir √ñnundarson
bio:
Bj√∂rn Heimir √ñnundarson (b. 1996) is a cartoonist, illustrator, animator and a painter.
Bj√∂rn has mainly been making animation short films and doing cartoons for the Morgunbla√∞i√∞ newspaper the past few years, but has also worked in various areas such as making and releasing comics, posters, album covers and other assignments.
Bj√∂rn graduated from the Reykjav√≠k School of visual arts in 2018.
